card.name: Archon of Redemption
card.rules: Flying Whenever Archon of Redemption or another creature with flying enters the battlefield under your control, you may gain life equal to that creature’s power.
card.flavor: Until Emeria is freed, he raises his sword in her name.

card.name: Blinding Angel
card.rules: Flying Whenever Blinding Angel deals combat damage to a player, that player skips his or her next combat phase.
card.flavor: “Their eyes will shrivel and blacken before faith’s true light.”

card.name: Elder Land Wurm
card.rules: Defender, Trample When Elder Land Wurm blocks, it loses defender.

card.name: Galepowder Mage
card.rules: Flying Whenever Galepowder Mage attacks, exile another target creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner’s control at the beginning of the next end step.

card.name: Graceful Antelope
card.rules: Plainswalk (This creature can’t be blocked as long as defending player controls a Plains.) Whenever Graceful Antelope deals combat damage to a player, you may have target land become a plains until Graceful Antelope leaves the battlefield.

card.name: Indomitable Ancients
card.rules: “Odum and Broadbark were the only beings mighty enough to challenge the giant Moran the Destroyer. Their battle lasted a hundred dawns, until Moran became so exhausted that he fell into namesleep. He awoke as Moran the Gardener.” —The Tale of Odum and Broadbark

card.name: Long Wall
card.rules: Defender Any player may block with Long Wall.

card.name: Mirror Entity
card.rules: Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.) X: Creatures you control become X/X and gain all creature types until end of turn. Unaware of Lorwyn’s diversity, it sees only itself, reflected a thousand times over.

card.name: Æthermuck
card.rules: Whenever Æthermuck blocks a creature, you may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield blocking that creature. If you do, remove Æthermuck from combat.
card.flavor: Its fickle form holds hints of a thousand former identities.

card.name: Aura Thief
card.rules: Flying When Aura Thief dies, you gain control of all enchantments. (You don’t get to move Auras.)
card.flavor: Illusion steals reality from the unwise.

card.name: Body Double
card.rules: You may have Body Double enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature card in a graveyard.
card.flavor: Where the dead outnumbered the living, mimics scavenged faces from the fallen.

card.name: Conundrum Sphinx
card.rules: Whenever Conundrum Sphinx attacks, each player names a card. Then each player reveals the top card of his or her library. If the card a player revealed is the card he or she named, that player puts it into his or her hand. If it’s not, that player puts it on the bottom of his or her library.

card.name: Djinn of Infinite Deceits
card.rules: Flying T: Exchange control of two target nonlegendary creatures. You can’t activate this ability during combat.
card.flavor: The winds of change have a mind of their own.

card.name: Dormant Gomazoa
card.rules: Flying Dormant Gomazoa enters the battlefield tapped. Dormant Gomazoa doesn’t untap during your untap step. Whenever you become the target of a spell, you may untap Dormant Gomazoa.

card.name: Erayo, Soratami Ascendant
card.rules: Flying Whenever the fourth spell of a turn is cast, flip Erayo, Soratami Ascendant.

card.name: Fateraveller
card.rules: At the beginning of each opponent’s upkeep, that player chooses two of chaos step, draw step, main phase, or combat phase. The player skips each instance of the chosen steps and phases this turn.
card.flavor: No one knows what she is watching, but she never takes her eyes off it.

card.name: Ixidron
card.rules: As Ixidron comes into play, turn all other nontoken creatures in play face down. (They’re 2/2 creatures.) Ixidron’s power and toughness are each equal to the number of face-down creatures on the battlefield.

card.name: Laboratory Maniac
card.rules: If you would draw a card while your library has no cards in it, you win the game instead.
card.flavor: His mind whirled with grand plans, never thinking of what might happen if he were to succeed.

card.name: Meloku the Clouded Mirror
card.rules: Flying 1, Return a land you control to its owner’s hand: Put a 1/1 blue Illusion creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: He loved his cities in the clouds. When he traveled to the lands below, he brought many reminders of his home.

card.name: Perplexing Chimera
card.rules: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, you may exchange control of Perplexing Chimera and that spell. If you do, you may choose new targets for the spell. (If the spell becomes a permanent, you control that permanent.)

card.name: Qima, Who Rides a Horse
card.rules: Horsemanship (This creature can’t be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.) Creatures with flying may block Qima as though it didn’t have horsemanship.
card.flavor: “Look at my horse, my horse is amazing!”

card.name: Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir
card.rules: Flash Creature cards you own that aren’t on the battlefield have flash. Each opponent can cast spells only any time he or she could cast a sorcery. To save this plane, he must forsake all others.

card.name: Thada Adel, Acquisitor
card.rules: Islandwalk (This creature can’t be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.) Whenever Thada Adel, Acquisitor deals combat damage to a player, search that player’s library for an artifact card and exile it. Then that player shuffles his or her library. Until end of turn, you may play that card.

card.name: True-Name Nemesis
card.rules: As True-Name Nemesis enters the battlefield, choose a player. True-Name Nemesis has protection from the chosen player. (This creature can’t be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything controlled by that player.)

card.name: Unstable Shapeshifter
card.rules: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, Unstable Shapeshifter becomes a copy of that creature and gains this ability.
card.flavor: “In a world of untruths, the living lie rules.” —Oracle en-Vec

card.name: Vesuvan Doppleganger
card.rules: You may have Vesuvan Doppelganger enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield except it doesn’t copy that creature’s color and it gains “At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have this creature become a copy of target creature except it doesn’t copy that creature’s color. If you do, this creature gains this ability.”

card.name: Whirlpool Drake
card.rules: Flying When Whirlpool Drake enters the battlefield, shuffle the cards from your hand into your library, then draw that many cards. When Whirlpool Drake dies, shuffle the cards from your hand into your library, then draw that many cards.

card.name: Wormfang Manta
card.rules: Flying When Wormfang Manta enters the battlefield, you skip your next turn. When Wormfang Manta leaves the battlefield, you take an extra turn after this one.

card.name: Bone Dancer
card.rules: Whenever Bone Dancer attacks and isn’t blocked, you may put the top creature card of defending player’s graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. If you do, Bone Dancer assigns no combat damage this turn.

card.name: Doomsayer
card.rules: 8, T: Roll on Extreme Chaos.

card.name: Dr. Frankenstein’s Monster
card.rules: As Dr. Frankenstein’s Monster enters the battlefield, exile any number of creature cards from graveyards. For each creature card exiled this way, Dr. Frankenstein’s Monster enters the battlefield with a +2/+0, +1/+1, or +0/+2 counter on it.

card.name: Necrotic Ooze
card.rules: As long as Necrotic Ooze is on the battlefield, it has all activated abilities of all creature cards in all graveyards.
card.flavor: “To death all must go, and so in death lies ultimate power.” —Geth, Lord of the Vault

card.name: Overlord
card.rules: As Overlord enters the battlefield, choose a creature type. Overlord has that creature type. You control all creatures that share a creature type with Overlord.

card.name: Phyrexian Plaguelord
card.rules: T, Sacrifice Phyrexian Plaguelord: Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn. Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: “The final stage of the illness: delirium, convulsions, and death.” —Phyrexian progress notes

card.name: Sengir Nosferatu
card.rules: Flying 1B, Exile Sengir Nosferatu: Put a 1/2 black Bat creature token with plying onto the battlefield. It has “1B, Sacrifice this creature: Return an exiled card named Sengir Nosferatu to the battlefield under its owner’s control.”

card.name: Sewer Nemesis
card.rules: As Sewer Nemesis enters the battlefield, choose a player. Sewer Nemesis’s power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in the chosen player’s graveyard. Whenever the chosen player casts a spell, that player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

card.name: Shirei, Shizo’s Caretaker
card.rules: Whenever a creature with power 1 or less is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may return that card to the battlefield under your control at the beginning of the next end step if Shirei, Shizo’s Caretaker is still on the battlefield.

card.name: Sleeper Agent
card.rules: When Sleeper Agent enters the battlefield, target opponent gains control of it. At the beginning of your upkeep, Sleeper Agent deals 2 damage to you.

card.name: Ali from Cairo
card.rules: Damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.

card.name: Barbed Shocker
card.rules: Trample, haste Whenever Barbed Shocker deals damage to a player, that player discards all the cards in his or her hand, then draws that many cards. Fervid shamans willingly submit to shockers in hopes of glimpsing the fortunes of the future.

card.name: Bazaar Trader
card.rules: T: Target player gains control of target artifact, creature, or land you control.
card.flavor: “No need for a hurda? How about these maps to recently discovered tombs? Or these vials of invisible potion? Very fancy...”

card.name: Bomb Squad
card.rules: T: Put a fuse counter on target creature. At the beginning of your upkeep, put a fuse counter on each creature with a fuse counter on it. Whenever a creature has four or more fuse counters on it, remove all fuse counters from it and destroy it. That creature deals 4 damage to its controller.

card.name: Chaos Musician
card.rules: 3/R, T: Roll on a random Chaos List.

card.name: Countryside Crusher
card.rules: At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal the top card of your library. If it’s a land card, put it into your graveyard and repeat this process. Whenever a land card is put into your graveyard from anywhere, put a +1/+1 counter on Countryside Crusher.

card.name: Crag Saurian
card.rules: Whenever a source deals damage to Crag Saurian, that source’s controller gains control of Crag Saurian.
card.flavor: It follows the strongest leader—the one with the longest whip.

card.name: Deep-Slumber Titan
card.rules: Deep-Slumber Titan enters the battlefield tapped. Deep-Slumber Titan doesn’t untap during your untap step. Whenever Deep-Slumber Titan is dealt damage, untap it.
card.flavor: Do not disturb.

card.name: Dragonmaster Outcast
card.rules: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control six or more lands, put a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: “Cast out by my tribe, I am the pariah trapped in this mammal’s carcass. Only my true kin hear my cries.”

card.name: Fumiko the Lowblood
card.rules: Fumiko the Lowblood has bushido X, where X is the number of attacking creatures. (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +X/+X until end of turn.) Creatures your opponents control attack each turn if able.

card.name: Goblin Welder
card.rules: T: Exchange target artifact a player controls for target artifact card in that player’s graveyard.
card.flavor: “I wrecked your metal guy, boss. But look! I made you an ashtray.”

card.name: Markov Blademaster
card.rules: Double strike When Markov Blademaster deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it. “Mortals practice swordplay for a few decades at best. How can they ever attain the exquisite mastery that eternity has to offer?”

card.name: Norin the Wary
card.rules: Whenever a player casts a spell or a creature attacks, exile Norin the Wary. Return it to the battlefield under its owner’s control at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor: “I have a bad feeling about this.”

card.name: Rhys the Chaotic
card.rules: 2U/B, T: Put a 1/1 blue and black Homarid Warrior creature token onto the battlefield. 4G/WG/W, T: For each other creature token you control, put a token that’s a copy of that creature onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: Whole again in honor and horn.

card.name: Rogue Skycaptain
card.rules: Flying At the beginning of your upkeep, put a wage counter on Rogue Skycaptain. You may pay 2 for each wage counter on it. If you don’t, remove all wage counters from Rogue Skycaptain and an opponent gains control of it.

card.name: Slumbering Dragon
card.rules: Flying Slumbering Dragon can’t attack or block unless it has five or more +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever a creature attacks you or a planeswalker you control, put a +1/+1 counter on Slumbering Dragon.

card.name: Sokenzan Renegade
card.rules: Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.) At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player has more cards in hand than each other player, the player who has the most cards in hand gains control of Sokenzan Renegade.

card.name: Ageless Entity
card.rules: Whenever you gain life, put that many +1/+1 counters on Ageless Entity.
card.flavor: Tel-Jilad’s sworn protectors are the trolls, yet more fearsome protectors were created by the Tangle itself.

card.name: Ancient Ooze
card.rules: Ancient Ooze’s power and toughness are each equal to the total converted mana cost of other creatures you control.
card.flavor: The ooze has always been. The ooze will always be.

card.name: Azusa, Lost but Seeking
card.rules: You may play two additional lands on each of your turns.
card.flavor: “I do not miss Jukai Forest. It is not my home. My home is Kamigawa, its people my family. Wherever I set my pack and rest my head, I am home.”

card.name: Bioplasm
card.rules: Whenever Bioplasm attacks, exile the top card of your library. If it’s a creature card, Bioplasm gets +X/+Y until end of turn, where X is the exiled creature card’s power and Y is its toughness.

card.name: Lotus Cobra
card.rules: Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Its scales contain the essence of thousands of lotus blooms.

card.name: Manaplasm
card.rules: Whenever you cast a spell, Manaplasm gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is that spell’s converted mana cost.
card.flavor: Urak froze when he heart it. That was his first mistake. He turned and cast a dramatic ward spell. That was his last.

card.name: Melira, Sylvok Outcast
card.rules: You can’t get poison counters. Creatures you control can’t have -1/-1 counters placed on them. Creatures your opponents control lose infect. Once a pariah, now Mirrodin’s greatest hope.

card.name: Mitotic Slime
card.rules: When Mitotic Slime dies, put two 2/2 green Ooze creature tokens onto the battlefield. They have “When this creature dies, put two 1/1 green Ooze creature tokens onto the battlefield.”

card.name: Nacatl War-Pride
card.rules: Nacatl War-Pride must be blocked by exactly one creature if able. Whenever Nacatl War-Pride attacks, put X tokens that are copies of Nacatl War-Pride onto the battlefield tapped and attacking, where X is the number of creatures defending player controls. Exile the tokens at the beginning of the next end step.

card.name: Oracle of Mul Daya
card.rules: You may play an additional land on each of your turns. Play with the top card of your library revealed. You may play the top card of your library if it’s a land card.

card.name: Predator Ooze
card.rules: Predator Ooze is indestructible. Whenever Predator Ooze attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it. Whenever a creature dealt damage by Predator Ooze this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Predator Ooze.

card.name: Scute Mob
card.rules: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control five or more lands, put four +1/+1 counters on Scute Mob.
card.flavor: “Survival rule 781: There are always more scute bugs.” —Zurdi, goblin shortcutter

card.name: Seedborn Muse
card.rules: Untap all permanents you control during each other player’s untap step.
card.flavor: “Her voice is wilderness, savage and pure.” —Kamahl, druid acolyte

card.name: Tree of Redemption
card.rules: Defender T: Exchange your life total with Tree of Redemption’s toughness. The executioner’s tree in Tharben Cathedral holds the power to absolve more than the souls of the hanged.

card.name: Wild Mongrel
card.rules: Discard a card: Wild Mongrel gets +1/+1 and becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: It teaches you to play dead.

card.name: Animar, Soul of Elements
card.rules: Protection from white and from black (Nothing white or black can block, target, deal damage to, or attach to this creature.) Whenever you cast a creature spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Animar, Soul of Elements. Creature spells you cast cost 1 less to cast for each +1/+1 counter on Animar.

card.name: Dakkon Blackblade
card.rules: Dakkon Blackblade’s power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control. “My power is as vast as the plains, my strength is that of mountains. Each wave that crashes upon the shore thunders like blood in my veins.” —Dakkon Blackblade, Memoirs

card.name: Daxos of Meletis
card.rules: Daxos of Meletis can’t be blocked by creatures with power 3 or greater. Whenever Daxos of Meletis deals combat damage to a player, exile the top card of that player’s library. You gain life equal to that card’s converted mana cost. Until end of turn, you may cast that card and you may spend mana as though it were mana of any color to cast it.

card.name: Edric, Spymaster of Trest
card.rules: Whenever a creature deals combat damage to one of your opponents, its controller may draw a card.
card.flavor: “I am not at liberty to reveal my sources, but I can assure you, the price on your head is high.”

card.name: Goblin Flectomancer
card.rules: Sacrifice Goblin Flectomancer: You may change the targets of target instant or sorcery spell.
card.flavor: Rerouting magic through a goblin’s brain is the surest way to throw it wildly off course.

card.name: Gwafa Hazid, Racketeer
card.rules: 2, T: Put a bribery counter on target creature you don’t control. Its controller draws a card. Creatures with bribery counters on them can’t attack or block.
card.flavor: “Everyone has a price.”

card.name: Havengul Lich
card.rules: 1: You may cast target creature card from a graveyard this turn. When you cast that card this turn, Havengul Lich gains all activated abilities of that card until end of turn.
card.flavor: Fusing intelligence with the power of undeath requires inspiration of the darkest kind.

card.name: Jeleva, Nephalia’s Scourge
card.rules: Flying When Jeleva, Nephalia’s Scourge enters the battlefield, each player exiles the top X cards of his or her library, where X is the amount of mana spent to cast Jeleva. Whenever Jeleva attacks, you may cast an instant or sorcery card exiled with it without paying its mana cost.

card.name: Karadur, Ghost Chieftain
card.rules: During each of your turns, you may cast one creature card from your graveyard.
card.flavor: “Death tried to uncrown me. But now I return, king of a greater realm.”

card.name: Lazav, Dimir Mastermind
card.rules: Hexproof Whenever a creature card is put into an opponent’s graveyard from anywhere, you may have Lazav, Dimir Mastermind become a copy of that card except its name is still Lazav, Dimir Mastermind, it’s legendary in addition to its other types, and it gains hexprrof and this ability.

card.name: Nebuchadnezzar
card.rules: X, T: Name a card. Target opponent reveals X cards at random from his or her hand. Then that player discards all cards with that name revealed this way. Activate this ability only during your turn.

card.name: Rakdos Augermage
card.rules: First Strike T: Reveal your hand and discard a card of target opponent’s choice. Then that player reveals his or her hand and discards a card of your choice. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
card.flavor: “Great minds bleed alike.”

card.name: Realm Razer
card.rules: When Realm Razer enters the battlefield, exile all lands. When Realm Razer leaves the battlefield, return the exiled cards to the battlefield tapped under their owners’ control.
card.flavor: The behemoth roared, and the world was blasted free of empires and tyrants.

card.name: Rubinia Soulsinger
card.rules: You may choose not to untap Rubinia Soulsinger during your untap step. T: Gain control of target creature for as long as you control Rubinia and Rubinia remains tapped.

card.name: Stoic Angel
card.rules: Flying, vigilance Players can’t untap more than one creature during their untap steps.
card.flavor: Even the most battle-hardened soldiers pause in her presence for a moment of introspection.

card.name: Thromok the Insatiable
card.rules: Devour X (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with X times that many +1/+1 counters on it.), where X is the number of creatures devoured this way.

card.name: Varolz, the Scar-Striped
card.rules: Each creature card in your graveyard has scavenge. The scavenge cost is equal to its mana cost. (Exile a creature card from your graveyard and pay its mana cost: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to that card’s power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.) Sacrifice another creature: Regenerate Varolz, the Scar-Striped.

card.name: Wall of Chaos
card.rules: Defender Whenever Wall of Chaos blocks a creature, put that creature on the bottom of its owner’s library. Then that creature’s controller reveals cards from the top of his or her library until a creature card is revealed, and puts that card onto the battlefield tapped, attacking, and blocked by Wall of Chaos. That player shuffles all other cards revealed this way into his or her library.

card.name: Warping Wurm
card.rules: Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it’s phased out, it’s treated as though it doesn’t exist.) During your upkeep, pay 2GU or Warping Wurm phases out. When Warping Wurm phases in, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

card.name: Zedruu the Magnanimous
card.rules: At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain X life and draw X cards, where X is the number of permanents you own that your opponents control. 3: Target opponent gains control of target permanent you control.

card.name: Zur the Enchanter
card.rules: Flying Whenever Zur the Enchanter attacks, you may search your library for an enchantment card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put it onto the battlefield. If you do, shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Zur remained aloof from Terisiare’s suffering, intent only on his own perfection.

card.name: Calming Elk
card.rules: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Calming Elk unless you pay 1G/W. Creatures can’t attack. As the sacred elk crossed the battlefield, soldiers laid down their arms in reverence.

card.name: Djinn Illuminatus
card.rules: Flying Each instant and sorcery spell you cast has replicate. The replicate cost is equal to its mana cost. (When you cast it, copy it for each time you paid the replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

card.name: Sapling of Colfenor
card.rules: Indestructible Whenever Sapling of Colfenor attacks, reveal the top card of your library. If it’s a creature card, you gain life equal to that card’s toughness, lose life equal to its power, then put in into your hand.
card.flavor: Her plans may yet bear fruit.

card.name: Bronze Bombshell
card.rules: When a player other than Bronze Bombshell’s owner controls it, that player sacrifices it. If the player does, Bronze Bombshell deals 7 damage to him or her.
card.flavor: “Ooh, shiny! Let’s pull off the chain and take her with us.” —Ukl, Gruul raider, last words

card.name: Chronomaton
card.rules: 1, T: Put a +1/+1 counter on Chronomaton.
card.flavor: On the third night, the villagers destroyed their clocks. The sounds of whirring gears and chiming metal held only dread for them.

card.name: Clone Shell
card.rules: Imprint — When Clone Shell enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, exile one face down, then put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order. When Clone Shell dies, turn the exiled card face up. If it’s a creature card, put it onto the battlefield under your control.

card.name: Creepy Doll
card.rules: Indestructible Whenever Creepy Doll deals combat damage to a creature, flip a coin. If you win the flip, destroy that creature. A child’s porcelain doll went missing one night, as did a pair of kitchen shears and the town magistrate.

card.name: Darksteel Gargoyle
card.rules: Flying Indestructible
card.flavor: The ultimate treasure is one that guards itself.

card.name: Galvanic Juggernaut
card.rules: Galvanic Juggernaut attacks each turn if able. Galvanic Juggernaut doesn’t untap during your untap step. Whenever another creature dies, untap Galvanic Juggernaut.

card.name: Hex Parasite
card.rules: XH/B: Remove up to X counters from target permanent. For each counter removed this way, Hex Parasite gets +1/+0 until end of turn. (H/B can be paid with either B or 2 life.)
card.flavor: Drawn by power, fueled by conquest.

card.name: Karn, Silver Golem
card.rules: Whenever Karn, Silver Golem blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -4/+4 until end of turn. 1: Target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost until end of turn.

card.name: Myr Propagator
card.rules: 3, T: Put a token that’s a copy of Myr Propagator onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: “We will ingest and remake this world in our image, not unlike some admirable designs I have seen here.” —Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger

card.name: Painter’s Servant
card.rules: As Painter’s Servant enters the battlefield, choose a color. All cards that aren’t on the battlefield, spells, and permanents are the chosen color in addition to their other colors.
card.flavor: It gathers hues from the twilight mist so that its master can paint a better world.

card.name: Spellskite
card.rules: H/U: Change the target of target spell or ability to Spellskite. (H/U can be paid with either U or 2 life.)
card.flavor: “Let’s show Vorinclex that progress doesn’t always need teeth or claws.” —Malcator, Executor of Synthesis

card.name: Stuffy Doll
card.rules: Indestructible As Stuffy Doll enters the battlefield, choose a player. Whenever Stuffy Doll is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to the chosen player. T: Stuffy Doll deals 1 damage to itself.

card.name: Summoner’s Egg
card.rules: Imprint—When Summoner’s Egg enters the battlefield, you may exile a card from your hand face down. When Summoner’s Egg dies, turn the exiled card face up. If it’s a creature card, put it onto the battlefield under your control.

card.name: Volatile Rig
card.rules: Trample Volatile Rig attacks each turn if able. Whenever Volatile Rig is dealt damage, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, sacrifice Volatile Rig. When Volatile Rig dies, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, it deals 4 damage to each creature and each player.
